result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D Sigl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
Sentence credit of 14 days was granted, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.  Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already precviously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract

Defendant Benjamin D Sigl in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in to count #1.

The State is not requesting any additional cash bail but is requesting the Court set the matter for a bail review in two weeks.  The Defendant is still on a wait list for Drug Treatment Court and should be admitted in approximately two weeks.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
